STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 3, 2023
Kathleen Schultz
Wellspring Lutheran Services - Oak Park
25900 Greenfield Rd. Ste. 401
Oak Park, MI, 48237-1267
RE: License#: CB630201261
Dear Kathleen Schultz:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on April 28, 2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 248-860-0787.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
CC: Rebecca Yowell
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for
each child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal
and at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
Eight foster care case records were reviewed. Twenty-four updated services
plans were reviewed. One report was late. The report dated 5/22/22 – 8/12/22
submitted on 9/14/22 was 25 days late.
REPEAT VIOLATION FROM INTERIM 2022
FOM 722-08D Treatment plans: Agreement and signatures
Once completed and approved, the caseworker must
obtain signatures from the following individuals, as
applicable: caseworkers, supervisors, second line
supervisor, when siblings in care are place apart.
Parents who are a member of a participating
household, youth ages14 or older, foster parents,
relative caregivers, and unrelated court ordered

caregivers. Parents/legal guardian, youth and
caregivers must check yes or no for the following when
signing the treatment plan: I have participated in the
development of the Case Service Plan and the Parent
Agency Treatment Plan.
Eight foster care case records were reviewed, (thirteen
of twenty – four PATP’s) reviewed were missing
signatures from caregivers, parents, youth and/or the
boxes were not check indicating participation with the
treatment plans.
FOM 801-03 - Medical passports
All medical information within the medical
passport must be current and updated at least quarterly
to reflect the child’s current and complete health
information.
Six of eight foster care case files did not have current
and complete health information documented quarterly
on the medical passports.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• No technical assistance was provided.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• All participants names need to be documented in the participates column on
the FTM screen in MiSACWIS.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows.
The Interim Inspection report dated 7/14/22, the CAP was accepted on 7/22/22. It
is noted that the agency is doing well with their CAP except for one repeat
violation of R400.12418 (2)(b) during this reporting period.
The agency had a Special investigation #2022C0420009 that was generated on
1/26/2022. The agency was in violation with rules 12404 – Placement, FOM 722-
06B Family Team Meeting and FOM 722-8E Foster care/Juvenile Action
Summary. The agency is completed with their CAP. This was verified by way of
CAP follow-up. Reviewed training of all staff, signatures and dates of training.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The CA reported staff turnover has negatively impacted the compliance with
licensing rules and policy. Since the last inspection, the agency loss three foster
care case managers. They are in the process of interviewing for two more case
managers. She reported when staff leave, their cases need to be re-assigned to
other foster care case managers or supervisors. CWTI and Certification/Complaint
training continues to be virtual. The CA said the supervisors continue to work
diligently, trying to be as supportive as possible to staff. CA identified CWLM as
another barrier and stated staff are becoming more confident with the system.
She reported having a large number of helpdesk tickets.
Financial Overview
The agency provided their annual budget. A copy of the nonprofit tax return from
the previous fiscal year was reviewed,
Staff and Youth Interviews
A licensing specialist and foster care worker was interviewed on site. They were
consistent in stating that administrative support and teamwork was the basis for
their longevity at the agency. They reported the administrative team support them
and encourages their mental health well-being. They are assigned a caseload of
ten opposed to thirteen which helps them greatly.
No youth were interviewed.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency has no safety issues.

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety concerns,
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that Wellspring Lutheran Services agency will be issued a renewal
of their regular license.
05/03/2023
_____________________________________
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
5/11/23
_____________________________________
Linda D Tansil Date
Area Manager
